verses.verse: And if a soul<WH5315> sin<WH2398>, and hear<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of swearing<WH423>, and is a witness<WH5707>, whether<WH176> he hath seen<WH7200> or known<WH3045> of it; if he do not utter<WH5046> it, then he shall bear<WH5375> his iniquity<WH5771>.

Or if a soul<WH5315> touch<WH5060> any unclean<WH2931> thing<WH1697>, whether it be a carcase<WH5038> of an unclean<WH2931> beast<WH2416>, or a carcase<WH5038> of unclean<WH2931> cattle<WH929>, or the carcase<WH5038> of unclean<WH2931> creeping things<WH8318>, and if it be hidden<WH5956> from him; he also shall be unclean<WH2931>, and guilty<WH816>.

Or if he touch<WH5060> the uncleanness<WH2932> of man<WH120>, whatsoever uncleanness<WH2932> it be that a man shall be defiled<WH2930> withal, and it be hid<WH5956> from him; when he knoweth<WH3045> of it, then he shall be guilty<WH816>.

Or if a soul<WH5315> swear<WH7650>, pronouncing<WH981> with his lips<WH8193> to do evil<WH7489>, or to do good<WH3190>, whatsoever it be that a man<WH120> shall pronounce<WH981> with an oath<WH7621>, and it be hid<WH5956> from him; when he knoweth<WH3045> of it, then he shall be guilty<WH816> in one<WH259> of these.
And it shall be, when he shall be guilty<WH816> in one<WH259> of these things, that he shall confess<WH3034> that he hath sinned<WH2398> in that thing:

And he shall bring<WH935> his trespass offering<WH817> unto the LORD<WH3068> for his sin<WH2403> which he hath sinned<WH2398>, a female<WH5347> from the flock<WH6629>, a lamb<WH3776> or a kid<WH8166> of the goats<WH5795>, for a sin offering<WH2403>; and the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him concerning his sin<WH2403>.

And if he<WH3027> be not able<WH1767> to bring<WH5060> a lamb<WH7716>, then he shall bring<WH935> for<WH854> his trespass<WH817>, which he hath committed<WH2398>, two<WH8147> turtledoves<WH8449>, or two<WH8147> young<WH1121> pigeons<WH3123>, unto the LORD<WH3068>; one<WH259> for a sin offering<WH2403>, and the other<WH259> for a burnt offering<WH5930>. he be: Heb. his hand cannot reach to the sufficiency of a lamb

And he shall bring<WH935> them unto the priest<WH3548>, who shall offer<WH7126> that which is for the sin offering<WH2403> first<WH7223>, and wring off<WH4454> his head<WH7218> from<WH4136> his neck<WH6203>, but shall not divide it asunder<WH914>:

And he shall sprinkle<WH5137> of the blood<WH1818> of the sin offering<WH2403> upon the side<WH7023> of the altar<WH4196>; and the rest<WH7604> of the blood<WH1818> shall be wrung out<WH4680> at the bottom<WH3247> of the altar<WH4196>: it is a sin offering<WH2403>.

And he shall offer<WH6213> the second<WH8145> for a burnt offering<WH5930>, according to the manner<WH4941>: and the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him for his sin<WH2403> which he hath sinned<WH2398>, and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him. manner: or, ordinance

But if he<WH3027> be not able to bring<WH5381> two<WH8147> turtledoves<WH8449>, or two<WH8147> young<WH1121> pigeons<WH3123>, then he that sinned<WH2398> shall bring<WH935> for his offering<WH7133> the tenth<WH6224> part of an ephah<WH374> of fine flour<WH5560> for a sin offering<WH2403>; he shall put<WH7760> no oil<WH8081> upon it, neither shall he put<WH5414> any frankincense<WH3828> thereon: for it is a sin offering<WH2403>.

Then shall he bring<WH935> it to the priest<WH3548>, and the priest<WH3548> shall take<WH7061> his handful<WH4393> <WH7062> of it, even a memorial<WH234> thereof, and burn<WH6999> it on the altar<WH4196>, according to the offerings made by fire<WH801> unto the LORD<WH3068>: it is a sin offering<WH2403>.

And the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him as touching his sin<WH2403> that he hath sinned<WH2398> in one<WH259> of these, and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him: and the remnant shall be the priest's<WH3548>, as a meat offering<WH4503>.
And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,

If a soul<WH5315> commit<WH4603> a trespass<WH4604>, and sin<WH2398> through ignorance<WH7684>, in the holy things<WH6944> of the LORD<WH3068>; then he shall bring<WH935> for his trespass<WH817> unto the LORD<WH3068> a ram<WH352> without blemish<WH8549> out of the flocks<WH6629>, with thy estimation<WH6187> by shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, after the shekel<WH8255> of the sanctuary<WH6944>, for a trespass offering<WH817>:

And he shall make amends<WH7999> for the harm<WH2398> that he hath done in the holy thing<WH6944>, and shall add<WH3254> the fifth part<WH2549> thereto, and give<WH5414> it unto the priest<WH3548>: and the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him with the ram<WH352> of the trespass offering<WH817>, and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.

And if a soul<WH5315> sin<WH2398>, and commit<WH6213> any<WH259> of these things which are forbidden to be done<WH6213> by the commandments<WH4687> of the LORD<WH3068>; though he wist<WH3045> it not, yet is he guilty<WH816>, and shall bear<WH5375> his iniquity<WH5771>.

And he shall bring<WH935> a ram<WH352> without blemish<WH8549> out of the flock<WH6629>, with thy estimation<WH6187>, for a trespass offering<WH817>, unto the priest<WH3548>: and the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him concerning his ignorance<WH7684> wherein he erred<WH7683> and wist<WH3045> it not, and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.
It is a trespass offering<WH817>: he hath certainly<WH816> trespassed<WH816> against the LORD<WH3068>.
